item.title: Underground drain blocked, 2nd May
item.description:
Blocked Drain, Watercourse & Riparian Responsibilities Yesterday I received a call about blocked drains and watercourses adjacent to the GWSR railway line on Two Hedges Road, Woodmancote. Gloucestershire County Council Highways promised to investigate the issue and fund repairs several years ago—yet the owner of the. Inflow affected is still waiting, with no progress made. I visited the site and met with GWSR’s civil engineer and Bishop’s Cleeve Flood Warden Jonathan Taylor, who also works with the GWSR drainage team. This is a timely reminder that riparian rights and responsibilities apply to those who own land or property next to a watercourse—residents have a duty to keep water flowing freely and prevent blockages. However, as in this case when it comes to highways drains or culverts, the responsibility usually lies with the County Council or other authorities. Which is why I have reported the issues raised and will be following up to ensure they’re properly addressed. Please can you confirm who is responsible for this particular watercourse that runs along Two Hedges Road as the drain is blocked and floods the neighbouring bungalow. The rainwater comes up from underground. Please feel free to get in touch—I’ll do my best to help get it sorted.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Two Hedges Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Storms drains blocked causing flooding in heavy rain., 2nd May
item.description:
There are two storm drains which go under the A38 and both appear to be blocked as Broadclose Road suffers from severe flooding in this area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A38, Down Hatherley, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lights not working most nights outside 31 and 30, 1st May
item.description:
Light outside 31 Redmarley Road comes on for 5 minutes then goes off for the rest of the night. Earlier this one was on and the 2 either side were off. At the time of making this report the one outside 31 was is off but the 2 either side are on. There is one outside 30 that is also off most nights. This has only happened since the clocks changed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Redmarley Road, Oakley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo bin overflowing, 1st May
item.description:
Bin not been emptied in weeks. Now overflowing and dog poo now all over pavement
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bulford Close, Brockworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Abandon roadworks on pavement, 1st May
item.description:
Gloucester Road (B4633) - on pavement by St Marks Methodist Chapel. Area is barricaded by 4 x plastic barricades - these all bear the Ringway logo (I believe these are the Council's contractors).A single spade has been abandoned within the barricades. This is causing considerable obstruction to pedestrians. This obstruction has remained for more than 2 weeks, and there is no evidence of any work being undertaken. Please remove barricades, or get on and complete whatever work is deemed necessary.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-8, Stow Court, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: Verge not cut, 1st May
item.description:
